intro: Cayaponia macrantha, commonly known as the giant cayaponia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are typically large, heart-shaped, and have a rough texture. Cayaponia macrantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
